thread.section_title: The Cut – Fashion, Beauty, Politics, Sex and Celebrity
thread.title: Outfit of the Week: A Different Way to Layer Up
thread.title_full: Outfit of the Week: A Different Way to Layer Up -- The Cut

author: Diana Tsui
title: Outfit of the Week: A Different Way to Layer Up
text:
Photo: Jody Rogac
When it comes to creative fall layering , we're big fans of thinking up new ways to wear as many clothes as possible without looking like Joey from Friends . If you're considering the highly controversial dress-over-pants styling trick, here's one way to do it. Instead of going for something voluminous on top, look to a slimmer, tuniclike style. This version from Clu mixes wool with silk for textural contrast, but you could also just stick to a solid wool shift, like these similar options from Zara , and pointy ballerinas — it's all a matter of personal preference. Just leave a little ankle showing, and you're good to go.
Photo: Jody Rogac
Trademark melange silk turtleneck, $328 at Trademark ; Clu silk and wool sleeveless dress, for similar try Theory Rosetta dress, $405 at Neiman Marcus , or Zara roundneck dress, $59.90 at Zara ; Apiece Apart patterned pants, for similar try J.Crew Collection cropped trousers, $325 at J.Crew
Photographer: Jody Rogac; styling by Diana Tsui; model: Alecia Morais at The Society; makeup by Allie Smith; hair by Takashi Ashizawa using Oribe Hair Care; photo editor: Emily Shornick; photo assistant: Tim Schutsky.
